etymologies: Old English hysope (reinforced in Middle English by Old French ysope), via Latin from Greek hyssōpos, of Semitic origin

definitions: a small bushy aromatic plant of the mint family, the bitter minty leaves of which are used in cooking and herbal medicine.
shortDefinitions: small bushy aromatic plant of mint family, bitter minty leaves of which are used in cooking and herbal medicine

definitions: (in biblical use) a wild shrub of uncertain identity whose twigs were used for sprinkling in ancient Jewish rites of purification.
shortDefinitions: (in biblical use) wild shrub of uncertain identity whose twigs were used for sprinkling in ancient Jewish rites of purification
